channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-7060] Region load balancing by table does not handle the case where a table's region count is lower than the number of the RS in the cluster
item.description:
When the table's region count is less than the count of region servers, the region balance algorithm will not move the region. For example, the cluster has 100 RS, the table has 50 regions sitting on one RS, they will not be moved to any of the other 99 RS.

This is because the algorithm did not calculate the under-loaded RS correctly. This is how the algorithm works with the above example:

avg-regions-per-RS=0.5
min-RS-per-RS=0
max-RS-per-RS=1

when they calculate the under loaded RS, the code is as below. Since regionCount=0, which is always >=min, so it will always skip, therefore, no underloaded RS are found.

Map<ServerName, Integer> underloadedServers = new HashMap<ServerName, Integer>();
for (Map.Entry<ServerAndLoad, List<HRegionInfo>> server:
serversByLoad.entrySet()) {
int regionCount = server.getKey().getLoad();
if (regionCount >= min)

{ break; }

underloadedServers.put(server.getKey().getServerName(), min - regionCount);
}

Later the function returns since underloaded RS size is 0

if (serverUnerloaded ==0) return regionsToReturn;
item.summary: Region load balancing by table does not handle the case where a table's region count is lower than the number of the RS in the cluster

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I have the patch ready, will upload soon.

Nice finding.


+      if (regionToTake == 0)

+      {

+        regionToTake = 1;

The above would produce unnecessarily high number of underloaded servers, right ?
The above handling for the case of regionToTake == min == 0 should be bounded by the number of regions in the table minus 1.

@Tianying:
Please remove your response from Release Notes and put them as comment.
Consider this scenario: there're 5 regions to be shed from the region server carrying all the regions of the table. For a cluster with many region servers (>> 5), the loop would put many entries into underloadedServers.

Running org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.TestDefaultLoadBalancer

Tests run: 4, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 1.606 sec

Running org.apache.hadoop.hbase.TestRegionRebalancing

2012-10-29 19:01:47.741 java[47270:1903] Unable to load realm mapping info from SCDynamicStore

Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 95.949 sec

Running 0.94 test suite now.

0.94 test suite completed.
TestReplication failed but is unrelated to the patch.

Running 0.92 test suite now.

The following comment was made by Tianying, in Release Notes section
@Ted
> The above would produce unnecessarily high number of underloaded servers, right ?

I think it shouldn't. Because when the code reach here, it means this server is an under-loaded RS. Therefore, it is not procuding un-necessary underloaded server. For the special case when min=1, max=1, we want to shed the extra regions to those RS what has regionCount of 0. And the regionToTake for those RS should be 1.
assign back to me. I will review Ted's patch and integrate with my patch.

There're two problems with initial patch:
1. since there would always be region server not carrying region(s) from the underlying table in this setting, load balancer would move regions unnecessarily in each run.
2. after the first balancing run, the regions of the underlying table have been spread out. There is no need to balance the table unless the list of online servers changes.

Here is result for 0.92 test suite:


Failed tests:   queueFailover(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.replication.TestReplication): Waited too much time for queueFailover replication. Waited 44939ms.



Tests run: 1161, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 8



[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

[INFO] BUILD FAILURE

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

[INFO] Total time: 2:00:37.302s

The test failure was not related to the patch.

Attached test shows how this patch fixes the problem.
It is tentative because it takes a long time to run the test (due to additional servers spun up):


[INFO] Total time: 5:32.574s

+ if (maxSeen == 1) return null; // table is balanced

Will this be needed? I mean do we need to check for maxSeen and then decide if it is already balacned?
The above check is needed to detect the scenario where a table's regions are fully balanced across cluster (1 region per server).

I had the same question as Ram... Why do we need to call out that special case? What if the table had exactly 2 (or 3...) regions per server?

Patch looks good otherwise.

@Ted
Logically the patch is fine. +1. May be the var name maxSeen can be renamed to give a better understanding?
See point #2 in my comment @ 30/Oct/12 05:11, this particular check prevents regions of the underlying table to 'churn' to region server(s) where there is no region from the table.
Renamed maxSeen as maxRegionCountPerServer

Integrated to 0.94

Thanks for the finding, Tianying.

Thanks for the review, Ram and Lars.
Patch for trunk.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12551404/7060-trunk.txt
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 85 warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 3 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/3182//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/3182//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop2-compat.html

Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/3182//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-common.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/3182//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop-compat.html

This message is automatically generated.
Integrated to trunk as well.
